author: murdocisgod
title: FPS/3rdPS Battle Royale on Cardano
description: Cardano needs more steam, adoption and  a fun game that will grow into a publisher of sorts fulfilling the true perks of Gamefi for cardano

f6_assessments.q0:
My initial feeling towards this project was fascination, supposing that I get to play a high quality game of my favorite genre while making some decent money out of playing as well. The project seems to be falling within the scope of the challenge setting, which is the large-scale immigration of players to the Cardado ecosystem. The proposer also poses a possible risk to the project, followed by a plausible resolution, even though the project sounds somewhat dependent on the funding.

Nevertheless, I would like to bring up some following deductions:
Firstly, if the proposer promises to deliver a A-listed well-crafted game, what content and features will the game contain, and will they be stimulating enough for players to give it a shot?
Currently as we speak, the Battle Royale genre scene is making huge strides in the gaming industry, with Apex Legends being the latest giant on top of the chain (even more impressive considering the game was just released nearly 3 years ago) and lesser-renowned titles like Fortnite and PUBG. And while none of those games above offer an income-generating mechanism, still, it’s worth keeping in mind that a majority of gamers aren’t just in it for making money. Hence, I suggest putting up some sophisticatedly specific details about the game should the proposer wish to strongly interest investors and the community.
Secondly, while the project does seemingly aim to benefit Cardano as a whole, I imagine the proposal would be more convincing with the addition of core metrics (in figures if possible). For instance, an estimation of a user base, income that each player could possibly earn or what NFTs will be utilized for the game.
f6_assessments.q1:
From the plan laid out by the team, I must say that while there are listed relevant stages for the development process of the game in the road map, I notice a lack of milestones that each stage would be predicted to accomplish. And perhaps, a particular year would sound more persuasive rather than “20xx”. 
While I cannot ensure that the budget requested is justifiable since I have no experience regarding application/game developing, its purpose, according to the proposal, is for hiring professionals to perfect the building of the game. However, there is no information, LinkedIn links, profiles or affiliations given to verify the background and expertise of those involved. This renders it difficult to provide a detailed feasibility assessment. I strongly advise that for future proposals, the team should present the plan breakdown in a manner that enables the community to evaluate more precisely.
f6_assessments.q2:
While the team does mention a means of tracking the development process in the form of quantitative indicators, whose framework will be based off the roadmap, I believe this section could benefit from a more detailed unraveling of the functions of said quantitative indicators. More specifically, what quotient or milestone should the project be expected to achieve at different marks of the roadmap?
Furthermore, the proposal has left out the part of citing what kinds of benefits the Cardano ecosystem would reap from the success of this game. The same pattern repeats in the listed SDG goals and KPI. Unfortunately, this is an error that should not be present.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal’s intention certainly aligns with the challenge since it aims to build a fun game that consists of Blockchain features such as play to earn, defi components and assets ownership intended for gamers. However, in my opinion, this plan is not articulated and presented properly. You have only vaguely introduced the idea of the solution without delivering any aspect of it. There is no description of how the game will be a solution for this challenge. If I’m being fair, it looks more like a short description of any random game on AppStore, and certainly not enough to deliver the idea for funding a whole project. I have so many thing to ask about this project, for instance “Where is the fun elements? What is the selling point of the game that will attract gamers and bring benefit for Cardano? Which platform will the game be on (mobile/PC?)” and such. So many questions that I can’t find the answers for them on this proposal. If you plan to run this project for at least 3 years, you definitely need a better presentation of the idea.
f6_assessments.q1: Since the idea is vaguely introduced, it’s very difficult to give the feasibility a fair feedback. Although I agree with the main outlines of this to-do list, I would like to see more details of it such as what you are going to do to plan the development, what kind of research you are going to do? In term of feasibility, I don’t think the proposer has done a well planning for what the team is going to do in this project. Everything still stays as ideas. There’s no detail of requirements of relevant skills or experiences for team members so it’s very difficult to justify the amount required
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal hugely lacks of key metrics. There are not any key metrics to measure so how can the auditors audit the game after its launch? There’s not indicator about any KPIs that could be used by the community to keep track of the progress of the project. Especially when this project is aimed to run for 3 years, it need a short and long term plan and a KPIs with time-related target so that the voters can have confidence in the project’s auditability. Thus, I would encourage the proposer to find some other KPIs that can help the community audit the proposal and have more confidence in it.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer has mentioned the main feature of the project right at the beginning. Also the impact the project would bring was showed in the proposal. However, it would be better if the team had given more clear information about what achievements they would make so that people could understand better and make comparison if those achievements aligned with the challenge’s key metrics or not. One good point is that the team has foreseen the possible risks in the future and also think about how to mitigate the situation.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer has provided a schedule outline as well as budget breakdown. About the way they presented the timeline, I think they should have paid more attention about writing the year, because for me personally, “20xx” is something unclear and pretty hard to understand. About the team members to complete the project, they have listed out essential positions. But I think it would be good if they could add additive information such as members’ name to increase reliability.
f6_assessments.q2: The team has pictured what success would look like to them and talked about some SDG goals they set. However, I think they should made it clearer about how the methods or tools they would use to measure the progress of the project. Also, as I can see, they didn’t clarify if the project is a whole new one or belongs to a previously funded one.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal aims to build a fun, high-quality game with the perks of GameFi on the blockchain. At first, the project sounded very potential and promising to success, however, the author does not make it very clear what the solution really is and to what extent its impact will be. The author says that this game will mimic “Sir Charles’s practical methodology”, but does not use even a word to explain what exactly that methodology is. Additionally, there are so many uncertainties in the proposal, which can be clearly seen in parts such as: “if it includes the ability to make money…” or “if the community felt necessary”. Besides, although this proposal is about creating a game, there are barely or just very meagre ideas of what the game is about, how it is built, which features of the game are related to blockchain and how it can help players to gain knowledge about the cryptocurrency or NFT. For me, the impact part of this proposal is more like an unshaped idea that suddenly popped out and was directly written down on paper without any meaningful research or careful consideration. My rating for this, hence, is only 1.
f6_assessments.q1: These is a huge difference between the roadmap and budget breakdown in this part. Just the “20xx” provided as the timeline for the project is already terrible, not even to mention some meagre works listed out with no detailed KPIs or key metrics to measure and track the progress. There are, fortunately, improvements in specifying the allocation of invested money, with very specific positions, numbers of people needed and salary per hour and month for different positions. However, when it comes to approximating the total amount of funded money required, there is a huge asynchrony, while the number given at the beginning of the proposal is 50.000 USD, and the number here is almost 10 times more (489.984 USD)?? As a result, the budget breakdown, despite its details, is still unreliable, and in the end, it is fair to say that this part of the proposal is another disappointment, thus my rating is 1.
f6_assessments.q2: Regarding auditability, this proposal lacks almost everything that is necessary to allow the community to follow its progress during development. The definition of this project’s success is vague, the goals are confusing without any metrics for evaluation. The author also lists out very lofty SDGs, but does not show how this project can address those goals in the future. In conclusion, I am confident to say that this proposal does almost nothing in terms of providing me with sufficient information to assess its progress in achieving the stated goals, and it is appropriate to give this another 1.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal has similar or identical proposals in other categories, but this is the one they need to be in. I do believe that the concept they have, and if it is to create a battle royale game on Cardano: that it fits the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: It is fairly easy to make a shooter these days with game engines that can almost do it out of the box. The issue would be working in the blockchain aspects. The proposer needs a team, or a company they are ready to work with, that can cover those aspects. To justify the funding: we all need to know a more solid direction of the game, the team, and some of the tech on how to make it happen (if not the tech details, then how those tech details are covered that gives confidence to approve this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: It is a good framework for something more focused and further along in development for the future. It is a good basic outline that needs many items filled in.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer suggests idea about creating a high quality game on Cardano blockchain. However, this proposer only states the idea but not clearly presents detailed technology of game, how to play, business and marketing plan, and implementation steps... As far as I'm concerned, this is not a very new idea. Also the game industry is profitable but very competitive, therefore, the proposer needs to be specific about its unique points or their strengths as compared to competitiors. I support the proposer' idea, but I think he need to put more efforts which could convince community more.
f6_assessments.q1: Well, I appreciate the proposer's effort to clearly show its roadmap, budget breakdown and personnel needs which is easily understandable to community. I would like the proposer to show more of his background information and related experience from his past which could show his ability to implement this project. Also, qualified team members plays very important to the long-term success of game development, therefore I suggest the proposer's to have human resource incentives and strategy to recruit talented members. If funded, the proposer would like to dedicate full time to this project, so I hope this project get more support from community.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal is still at the idea stage, however, I suggest the proposer should mention clearly about quantitative indicators of the project for community checking such as based on timeline of each task, number of users, social media interaction,...I hope the proposer could give more detailed information in the next round.

f6_assessments.q0: While battle royale games are all the rage and for good reason, this concept has apparently no unique or original concepts to share.  Developer wants a considerable sum of money and puts forth nothing of interest that it will be spent on.  If one desires to compete with the industry kings like Fortnite and Warzone, there needs to be some compelling originality behind it, and there unfortunately is none here.  Additionally there is no explanation whatsoever of how this integrates Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: The development "schedule" is confused and generic.  There are apparently no team members aside from the proposer, there doesn't seem to have been any work done at all.  "Development schedule outline" is a line item on the proposal.  Suggest the proposer put more effort into creating alliances and scouting for a team before asking for funding.
f6_assessments.q2: There is nothing here to audit.  There's no KPI whatsoever.  There needs to be some kind of a legitimate endgame and a timeline that will be followed, as well as metrics by which progress can be gauged.

solution: The plan is to build a fun high quality game with the perks of gamefi on the blockchain mimicking Sir Charles' practical methodology.
experience: An avid Cardano enthusiast and old school gamer. With experience in production, design, and programming. I have the understanding of games and practicality of utility to fulfill this mission. Securing funding would allow me to work on this full time.
